about.label: About me
about.title: Technical background with an applied security focus.
about.paragraph1: I'm a software engineer in my final year of studies, with a two-year university specialization in applied cybersecurity. That journey let me integrate security best practices into backend work, authentication, and deployments without losing sight of the user experience.
about.paragraph2: I work on SaaS solutions, API integrations, and automation with Python and JavaScript. My security focus is practical: I design coherent systems with clear data flows and documentation that keep every delivery maintainable and lower risk.
about.collaborationText: Open to technical collaborations, cross-project synergies, or simply exchanging ideas about product and development. Reach out via LinkedIn.

kobra.title: Financial platform supporting Cybersur's daily operations.
kobra.paragraph1: Kobra is the tailor-made solution I built for Cybersur. With a stack of , it centralizes billing, collections, and notifications so the finance team works with coherent, up-to-date information.
kobra.paragraph2: Scheduled cronjobs manage exports and data cleanup, while alert pipelines log every action. The entire flow is designed to provide instant visibility and cut repetitive manual work.

bullets.first: Automated workflows that drastically reduce collection follow-up times.
bullets.second: Traceable cronjobs for exports and cleanup routines that keep data consistent.
bullets.third: Internal dashboards with the metrics needed to monitor payments and outstanding balances.

kobra.next: Next iteration: expand internal financial reports and automate reconciliations.
kobra.diagramContent:
Cybersur team
    ↓
FastAPI API → MySQL
    │
    ├─ Celery workers → Emails & reminders
    └─ Scheduled cronjobs → CSV reports

beatlist.title: Professional playlist management with Spotify's official seal.
beatlist.paragraph1: BeatList serves music lovers, curators, and creators who need more than Spotify's native manager. It combines advanced administration, discovery, and analytics in a fluid experience.
beatlist.paragraph2: Thanks to the official and approved authentication, the Flask backend accesses extended data with professional-grade stability and offloads heavy analyses to Celery to keep the experience smooth. The JavaScript frontend offers dashboards and a web player with custom micro-interactions.

bullets.first: Playlist merging, cleanup, and reordering with intelligent rules based on metrics like energy or danceability.
bullets.second: Recommendation engine by favorite artists and genres, plus dashboards showing listening habits.
bullets.third: Celery-powered analyses process data in the background to deliver precise metrics without disrupting the user experience.

beatlist.next: Future evolutions: collaborative mode or insight exports in upcoming versions.
beatlist.diagramContent:
Web client
    ↓
Flask API (Spotify OAuth 2.0)
    ↓
Celery workers → Heavy analyses & metrics
    ↓
JS dashboards + Player

mesasya.title: Smart reservations for restaurant chains.
mesasya.paragraph1: MesasYa is a production-ready SaaS that digitalizes reservations for multi-location restaurants. It offers granular occupancy control, automated communications, and dashboards tailored for managers.
mesasya.paragraph2: With as a base, the solution ships via Docker Compose with strong security practices, keeping workflows customizable per area, service, and team. Analytics and exports adapt to business decisions.

bullets.first: Interactive, configurable floor plans per venue, area, and service.
bullets.second: Automatic notifications for internal teams and final guests.
bullets.third: Exportable demand, capacity, and performance indicators for strategic decisions.

mesasya.next: Next steps: add automated reporting and keep improving the manager experience.
mesasya.diagramContent:
Staff & online reservations
    ↓
Flask API → MySQL
    │
    ├─ Celery workers → Emails & SMS
    └─ Docker Compose → Orchestrated services

orderya.title: Unified production and delivery management.
orderya.paragraph1: Built with for maximum speed, it allows managing complex catalogs, prices, and users with differentiated roles. All deployed securely and scalably.

bullets.first: Unified order portal that eliminates transcription errors.
bullets.second: Automatic generation of production sheets and delivery notes.
bullets.third: Robust Docker infrastructure ready for multiple clients.

orderya.next: Evolution: Future integration with billing systems.

trato.title: Agile CRM for quotes, follow-ups, and reminders.
trato.paragraph1: Trato is the lightweight CRM that centralizes quotes, follow-ups, and reminders into a fast workflow. Powered by a stack running on Uvicorn, it keeps sales teams moving without friction.
trato.paragraph2: Invitation codes govern how companies and users join, while Celery tasks automate reminders and daily summaries. The panel prioritizes operational speed on both desktop and mobile.

bullets.first: Guided quote flow with custom states and per-opportunity notes.
bullets.second: Automated reminders handled by Celery plus internal notifications.
bullets.third: Containerized deployment on the primary VPS with backups and basic monitoring.

trato.next: Next steps: expand conversion metrics and automate leadership-ready reports.
trato.diagramContent:
Invited companies
    ↓
FastAPI + Uvicorn → MySQL
    │
    ├─ Celery workers → Reminders
    └─ Docker Compose → Primary VPS

micartaya.title: 360º management of the restaurant experience.
micartaya.paragraph1: MiCartaYa is a comprehensive solution to digitize the interaction between restaurant and customer. Based on and bidirectional communication, it enables instant and error-free order flows.
micartaya.paragraph2: The system stands out for its remote printing engine connecting the cloud with physical kitchen printers, and an admin panel that dynamically manages complex menus with videos and multi-language support.

bullets.first: Real-time order reception with latency under 1 second thanks to WebSockets.
bullets.second: Total stock and availability control with immediate reflection on the public menu.
bullets.third: Centralized management of multiple venues, allergens, and visual brand customization.

micartaya.next: Next steps: integration with payment gateways and support for home delivery.
micartaya.diagramContent:
Customer (QR) / Staff
    ↓
FastAPI (WebSockets) → MySQL
    │
    ├─ Printer Client (Local) → Kitchen Ticket
    └─ Dashboard (React) → Notifications

ponme.title: AI applied to intelligent personal style management.
ponme.paragraph1: Ponme democratizes the use of generative AI to solve the daily 'what should I wear' dilemma. It integrates the Gemini API to understand not just what clothes you have, but how to combine them based on context.
ponme.paragraph2: The application processes images locally to remove backgrounds and uses multimodal models to extract garment metadata (color, fabric, style), allowing for a 'digital closet' in minutes.

bullets.first: Intelligent outfit generation based on specific plans and weather variables.
bullets.second: On-device image processing to ensure privacy and speed.
bullets.third: Usage tracking system that helps rotate garments and improve sustainability.

ponme.next: Next steps: intelligent suitcase planner and shopping suggestions based on closet gaps.
ponme.diagramContent:
User (Mobile/PWA)
    ↓
FastAPI → PostgreSQL
    │
    ├─ Google Gemini API → Image Analysis
    └─ Rembg (Local) → Garment Segmentation

mesasya.label: Case study 01
mesasya.title: MesasYa — Multi-location reservation SaaS
mesasya.paragraph1: MesasYa is a production SaaS that digitizes reservation management for restaurants with multiple venues. It combines interactive layouts, customizable rules, and real-time notifications so each service runs smoothly.
mesasya.paragraph2: The backend built with relies on Docker Compose and solid security practices. Each restaurant configures zones, services, languages, and workflows without losing stability or traceability.

bullets.first: Configurable floor plans with venue, area, and event rules.
bullets.second: Automatic table assignment and real-time alerts for staff and guests.
bullets.third: BI-ready exports and metrics that support business decisions.

mesasya.nextText: Automated reporting integration and smoother management experience.
mesasya.schemaContent:
Web / staff bookings
    ↓
Flask API → MySQL
    │
    ├─ Celery workers → Emails/SMS
    └─ Docker Compose orchestrates services

micartaya.label: Case study 02
micartaya.title: MiCartaYa — Digital 360º dining experience
micartaya.paragraph1: MiCartaYa redefines restaurant interaction through a production SaaS platform for digital menus and self-managed ordering. It resolves manual ordering bottlenecks and ensures menu information is always up to date.
micartaya.paragraph2: The core of the project is a high-availability WebSocket system connecting guests with the restaurant dashboard and printing hardware, eliminating transcription errors and optimizing service times.

bullets.first: Drastic reduction in waiting times for orders and payments.
bullets.second: Dynamic price and availability management with a single click.
bullets.third: Automatic ticket printing in kitchen and bar via TCP/IP and USB protocols.

micartaya.nextText: Integrated at-table payments and customer loyalty features.
micartaya.schemaContent:
Guest (Mobile)
    ↓
Nginx → FastAPI (WS)
    │
    ├─ PostgreSQL / Redis
    └─ Printer Script (Local) → TPV

orderya.label: Case study 03
orderya.title: OrderYa — Integral order management
orderya.paragraph1: OrderYa eliminates the chaos of order management between workshops and points of sale. It replaces spreadsheets and scattered messages with a centralized platform where each store places orders intuitively and the workshop views consolidated demand.
orderya.paragraph2: Developed with and server-side rendering (Jinja2) to ensure speed and simplicity, the system manages complex catalogs, price lists per client, and automatic generation of delivery orders.

bullets.first: Store portal with history and real-time status.
bullets.second: Barcode scanning to streamline order creation.
bullets.third: Template creation, product management, and data export.

bullets.second: Follow-ups with automated reminders and a centralized opportunity timeline.

beatlist.label: Case study 06
beatlist.title: BeatList — Music suite for creators
beatlist.paragraph1: BeatList empowers curators and creators to go beyond Spotify's default tooling. It connects the with advanced analysis and interactive experiences validated by Spotify for Developers.
beatlist.paragraph2: The Flask backend with collects extended data and orchestrates Celery analyses to deliver metrics without blocking listeners. The frontend delivers players, dashboards, and mixing tools built for professionals and communities.

bullets.second: Dynamic dashboards and player with interactive experiences.

ponme.label: Case study 07
ponme.title: Ponme — AI-powered Fashion Assistant
ponme.paragraph1: Ponme is a B2C platform that applies multimodal models for personal closet management. It allows users to digitize their clothes and receive intelligent outfit suggestions generated by Gemini.
ponme.paragraph2: Using local computer vision techniques for image segmentation and advanced LLM reasoning for style matching, Ponme offers a seamless experience that optimizes the use of existing garments.

bullets.first: AI-suggested combinations considering event context and local weather.
bullets.second: Automatic garment cataloging (type, color, material) via visual analysis.
bullets.third: PWA mode for a native mobile experience with fast loading and functional offline.

ponme.nextText: Circular shopping recommendation algorithms and social fashion sharing.

User (PWA)
    ↓
FastAPI → PostgreSQL
    │
    ├─ Rembg API → Background
    └─ Google Gemini → Analysis
